alert.note: Alert for Borden; Dawson; Howard; Martin; Mitchell; Scurry (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 10 at 8:05PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Scurry, Mitchell, Borden, northeastern Martin, Howard and eastern Dawson Counties through 900 PM CDT... At 804 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking an outflow boundary due to thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles northwest of Lenorah to near Big Spring to 11 miles east of Forsan. Movement was northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph can be expected with this boundary as it moves northeast. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Big Spring, Snyder, Lamesa, Colorado City, Ackerly, Gail, Coahoma, Loraine, Sand Springs, Lenorah, Lake Colorado City, Lake Colorado City State Park, Inadale, Luther, Fluvanna, Colorado City Airport, J B Thomas Reservoir, Lamesa Municipal Airport, Champion Creek Reservoir and Westbrook. This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 172 and 228. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for western Texas.

area.areaDesc: Borden; Dawson; Howard; Martin; Mitchell; Scurry
